item.title: Digital Analytics Implementation Specialist
item.description:
• Digital Analytics Implementation Specialist

      Toronto, Ontario
        Waterloo, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        As part of the Global Marketing group, the role provides consulting and enablement services in the field of digital analytics with a focus on data collection design and tool administration. This is a hands-on role with significant scope that will require working closely with fellow digital analytics professionals, IT and business partners to enable and sustain rich data collection. 

        What will you do?

        • Administrate Adobe Analytics: governance, implementation, support and documentation

        • Administrate the Tealium iQ tag management system: governance, implementation/coding of tagging libraries, support and documentation

        • Translate business requirements into technical data collection designs and code to enable rich and accurate data collection for web analytics and digital marketing tools, notably Adobe Analytics and various digital advertising platforms

        • Validate and approve data collection before Production deployments

        • Maintain detailed documentation of data collection designs, implementations and dependencies (i.e., a Solution Design Reference or SDR)

        • Develop relationships with external vendors as well as internal stakeholder groups such as IT and digital marketing teams

        • Identify opportunities for new data and tools that enhance analysis and insights

        • Identify and resolve data collection issues

        • Provide consulting and information on any technical or implementation related questions

        • Contribute to enterprise digital analytics requirements

        • Continually optimize data collection methodologies, business processes and configurations

        • Provide general digital analytics support, as required

        What do you need to succeed?

        • University degree with 3-6 years of experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience

        • 1+ year’s experience implementing analytics data collection through a tag management tool (e.g. Tealium)

        • 1+ year’s experience using a web analytics tool (e.g. Adobe Analytics)

        • Intermediate to advanced JavaScript skills, as well as familiarity with HTML and CSS (understanding of jQuery preferred)

        • Experience with web APIs, databases and ETL an asset

        • Experience in debugging JS based data collection using tools such as Fiddler and Google Chrome Developer Tools

        • Experience with implementing and managing digital advertising tracking tags

        • Self starter, highly motivated to excel w/minimal supervision

        • Keen attention to detail and thoroughness

        What\'s in it for you?

        • 15 days vacation per year

        • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

        • Wellness programs that support the three pillars of your health – mental, physical and financial

        • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

        *LI-NB1

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        Salary Range:

        49,400/49 400 - 80,800/80 800

        Job Category:

        Advanced Analytics

        Posting End Date:

        27/08/2021
      Apply
          Posted Today
            Full time
              JR00045682

            About Us

              • PASSION.

                We\'re committed to making life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Our passion and purpose have fuelled us for more than 150 years. We\'re there for our Clients in the moments that matter most. We create opportunities to make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities  around the world.

                PEOPLE.

                We believe in harnessing your intellectual power and developing the best, brightest and most passionate people to serve our Clients.

                Diversity is our strength. We support an inclusive environment where you\'re a leader, collaborator, innovator and trusted partner.

                EMPLOYER OF CHOICE.

                We\'re consistently recognized as a top employer. We offer competitive pay, a flexible and progressive benefits programs, total rewards, agile work environments and more.

                Year after year, we\'re named as one of the world\'s most sustainable organizations. We invest in preventing diabetes on a global scale and lead community-based programs to improve the lives of individuals and families where we all live and work.

item.title: AVP, Analytical Decision Engines
item.description:
• AVP, Analytical Decision Engines

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Montreal Metcalfe
          Waterloo, Ontario
        Apply

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          Client Experience Office (CXO) aims to provide a holistic "One Sun Life" experience to Clients as we help them achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives. We design and execute clear, compelling, caring journeys to help Clients navigate some of the most important moments of their lives. Through personalized, proactive and relevant content, we act on a deep understanding of Client needs on a multitude of communication channels—so we can be there for Clients when and where they need us.

          To understand our Clients, we actively listen and learn by employing experts in Client experience, engagement, marketing, strategy, and digital, data and analytics. Our Client Solutions Centre (CSC) engages directly with plan members to ensure they maximize the value of their benefit and retirement plans.

          What will you do?

          Reporting to the VP Analytics and Insights, Client Experience Office, the Associate Vice President (AVP) Analytics Decision Engines will lead the creation, implementation and evolution of data-powered  decision engines that provide recommendations and insights to clients through prescriptive analytics.

          The AVP will oversee a team of around 14 people (located in Toronto and Waterloo).  This executive will leverage data analytics to identify/develop sales and service opportunities to deepen client relationships and to drive strong client satisfaction scores, high client retention, and profitable growth for Sun Life.

          A key responsibility of this role is to lead the evolution of Sun Life’s autonomous prescriptive analytics, including “Next best Action” algorithms implemented in automated, machine learning platforms. Proven practical experience in this area is an important requirement for this role.

          Key priorities for this role are as follows:

          Lead the development of the “Next Best Action” recommendation engine across all client touchpoints:

          • Lead the design, architecture and delivery of client engagement and recommendation platforms, including the evolution of autonomous prescriptive analytics

          • Conceptualize and implement a model to translate value of different potential real-life actions (outbound call, send e-mail,  digital nudge) into a quantifiable measure that can be used by machine-learning systems to prioritize decisions based on propensity and expected impact

          • Work closely with the Client Engagement team assessing performance of the recommendation and continuously evolving the platform, including expansion to more business units, products and touchpoints

          Lead the development of the “smart assignment” analytical models to optimize matching of leads to the best suited advisors:

          • Work closely with the Client Acquisition team to define the strategy and the key factors to be taken into account in matching algorithms

          • Derive insights from the matching data to identify other potential success drivers and continuously work to improve performance of the engine

          • Identify other areas of opportunity where the engine can be applied to increase recommendation success

          Embed rigorous performance management practices:

          • Proactively develop and track metrics and measures to evaluate and determine the effectiveness of marketing programs, customer offers, etc.

          • Leverage data/analytics to ensure that strong financial/commercial management practices are in place, through the efficient allocation of marketing spend across initiatives based on ROI.

          What do you need to succeed?

          • Over ten years of data analytics experience, with a minimum of 3 years in a management/leadership role related to prescriptive analytics

          • S/he understands statistical and machine-learning techniques, including data preparation methods such as transformations, normalization, and modeling methods including linear and nonlinear regression techniques (applied to customer and sales analytics).

          • The successful candidate will have a strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.

          • Financial services industry experience is preferred but not essential

          • The successful candidate will be a strategic, conceptual thinker with strong written and oral communications skills who is able to influence the opinion of others.

          • S/he will have demonstrated the ability to operate in a highly matrixed environment, influencing and leveraging resources that do not report to her/him directly, and possess strong interpersonal skills

          Proven experience in prescriptive analytics and machine learning:

          • Design and architecture: Ability to conceptualize prescriptive analytics from identification of data requirements to design of solution

          • Delivery and results tracking: Experience in implementation of operational prescriptive analytics models, tracking of results and continuous improvement of model performance

          • Proven track record implementing “Next Best Action” models and machine-learning algorithms

          Strong quantitative, analytical and technical skills:

          • Strong quantitative background: Has impressive intellectual acumen and well-versed in key quantitative and data-driven disciplines as statistics, mathematics and finance

          • Robust understanding of data sufficiency and hypothesis-driven approach: Knows how to formulate hypothesis, design and run controlled tests to be able to conclusively identify significance in results, proving or refuting hypothesis

          • Broad understanding of different data & analytics methodologies and tools, including SAS, Open source (Python, AWS, SageMaker) and autonomous analytics (machine-learning)

          Leading Teams:

          • Building talent: A proven leader able to build, lead, motivate and retain high performing teams. Insightful about the talent the organization needs to be successful; recruits and develops people with this in mind. Uses multiple methods to grow capability in the organization. Skillfully coaches and mentors others.

          • Inspiring and motivating: Gets the best performance from people. Taps into people’s needs, interests and goals to motivate them to achieve. Inspires commitment from people and mobilizes teams toward high performance and goal achievement.

          • Integrity: Adheres to the highest standards of personal and professional integrity and sets a positive example for others.

          What’s in it for you?

          • Being a member of the Sun Life family, a group of people united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives

          • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

          • Joining a reputable organization with over 150 years of history

          The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

          Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

          Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

          At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

          We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

          Salary Range:

          115,700/115 700 - 197,200/197 200

          Job Category:

          Advanced Analytics

          Posting End Date:

          10/09/2021
        Apply
            Posted Yesterday

                • PASSION.

                  We\'re committed to making life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Our passion and purpose have fuelled us for more than 150 years. We\'re there for our Clients in the moments that matter most. We create opportunities to make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities  around the world.

                  PEOPLE.

                  We believe in harnessing your intellectual power and developing the best, brightest and most passionate people to serve our Clients.

                  Diversity is our strength. We support an inclusive environment where you\'re a leader, collaborator, innovator and trusted partner.

                  EMPLOYER OF CHOICE.

                  We\'re consistently recognized as a top employer. We offer competitive pay, a flexible and progressive benefits programs, total rewards, agile work environments and more.

                  Year after year, we\'re named as one of the world\'s most sustainable organizations. We invest in preventing diabetes on a global scale and lead community-based programs to improve the lives of individuals and families where we all live and work.

item.title: Senior Analyst, Strategic Insights
item.description:
• Senior Analyst, Strategic Insights

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Sun Life Canada Distribution (SLFD) is one of the leading financial institutions that offer Canadians holistic advice and solutions including insurance, wealth and health through a team of digitally-enabled and insights-driven human financial advisors.

        Reporting to the Director, Distribution Analytics, the Senior Analyst, Strategic Insights will support the business with deep analytics and insights to answer strategic and operational questions primarily for the Distribution team.

        The position will be located at the Sun Life office in Toronto or Waterloo.

        What will you do?

        •     Partner with the Distribution team to uncover deep insights regarding opportunities in areas such as recruiting, sales network design and sales performance.

        •     Work with stakeholders to clearly define problem statements or questions to address with data analysis.

        •     Collaborate with the Strategy team to deliver projects on these topics supporting distribution.

        •     Provide modeling support and insights regarding potential changes and the impact of recent changes to Distribution programs and key metrics.

        •     Ensure that the reporting needs for Distribution are appropriately met, teaming with BI Analysts on the SLFD Analytics team who will deliver on these needs.

        •     Turn complex data into easy to understand insights that are aligned to business objectives. Use visualizations and appropriate graphs and charts to elicit insights.

        •     Work with leaders and internal clients to identify where insights might add the most value in driving effective decision making and frame the analytics support to deliver these insights.

        •     Develop effective presentations of findings and present to multiple levels of stakeholders.

        What will you need to succeed?

        •     5+ years\' experience in delivering insights and analytics. Preferred experience in the financial services industry, sales or distribution.

        •     Experience on a strategy team or in delivering analytics driven projects that influence strategy.

        •     Experience in using data analysis tools such as Microsoft SQL server, SAS EG or similar. Must be a power user of Excel and able to develop and maintain VBA macros.

        •     Must be proficient in SQL coding to query and analyze data.

        •     Experience in working in an agile development environment including rapid prototyping during sprints.

        •     Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering or equivalent is preferred.

        Competencies:

        •     Ability to work independently, manage engagements or parts of large engagements directly with business partners.

        •     Solid understanding of how to consolidate and transform data to meaningful and actionable information.

        •     Ability to draw out meaningful business insights by synthesizing information from multiple data sources.

        •     Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation and storytelling with data.

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

item.title: Data Analyst
item.description:
• Data Analyst

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        As one of Sun Life Canada’s largest business units, Insurance Solutions is responsible for designing and distributing leading-edge life and health insurance products to over 2 million individual retail clients across Canada.

        Reporting to the Director, Business Intelligence, the Data Analyst will play an integral role in assembling the necessary data products to fuel a myriad of business intelligence reporting and advanced analytics initiatives within Insurance Solutions.

        The ideal candidate is a challenge-seeking, intellectually curious analytics professional with a deep passion for turning data into actionable insights to drive business decisions and solving data challenges in new and innovative ways.

        What will you do?

        • Analyze large quantities of data, draw out business insights from analytical output, and work with team leads to put together business recommendations
        • Assemble datasets to support various business intelligence, advanced analytics, data exploration, and self-service analytics initiatives within Insurance Solutions
        • Build the data infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and integration of data from disparate data sources using SQL and cloud-based big data technologies
        • Update data models to reflect the key business entities within Insurance Solutions
        • Assist in design of new solutions and strategies for data capture, processing and consumption across data platforms (relational, dimensional, and NoSQL) that meet the needs of a variety of consumption patterns (visualization, analytics, and machine learning)
        • Oversee and govern the expansion of our existing data architecture and the optimization of data query performance via best practices
        • Collaborate with IT partners and other analytics teams within Sun Life Canada to build out the data environment and analytics work platforms

        What do you need to succeed?

        • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Business, or equivalent
        • 2+ years of data analysis experience, including data extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a variety of sources
        • Experience writing efficient and complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources
        • Understanding of modern data management principles (e.g. data warehousing) with hands-on relational, dimensional, and/or analytic experience (using RDBMS, dimensional, NoSQL data platform technologies, and ETL and data ingestion protocols)
        • Experience using one or more statistical programming languages (Python/R/SAS) to work with data sets
        • Experience with data visualization tools, specifically Tableau
        • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to work independently and in close collaboration with technical and business teams

        What will be nice to have?

        • Hands-on experience working on cloud platforms (AWS) with data processing and analytical tools such as AWS SageMaker, Apache Zeppelin, Hive SQL, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, etc.
        • Familiarity with the Individual Insurance industry

        What’s in it for you?

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
        • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
        • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
        • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family
        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
        • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        49,400/49 400 - 80,800/80 800

        Job Category:

        Advanced Analytics

        Posting End Date:

        10/09/2021

item.title: Senior Data Analyst
item.description:
• Senior Data Analyst

      Toronto, Ontario
        Waterloo, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Role Summary:

        Bring us your passion for agile marketing, digital, and data analytics, and we’ll put you to work on exciting initiatives that answer the challenge: "How can we better engage and nudge our clients in taking action to reach their financial and wellness goals?” Working with a dedicated team of energetic, forward-thinking innovators, you’ll stretch your imagination and sharpen your skills on the leading-edge projects that are keeping Sun Life Financial ahead of the curve. You want more than a job; you want a career with a company that encourages learning and personal growth. You want to be “one of the best.”

        The Digital Benefits Assistant (DBA) program is helping our clients achieve financial security and well-being by being an integrated part of their lives, proactively providing personalized, useful and actionable information. The program will become a leading digital client engagement platform that will fuel the velocity of the Sun Life Canadian business units. DBA will create a differentiated competitive advantage with our sponsors who will value the superior benefit offering and sponsor-employee relationship. It will be a magnet for Canadian digital talent by growing, developing and empowering team members.

        The Senior Data Analyst of the Digital Benefits Assistant (DBA) Program is accountable for analyzing the success of campaigns created and executed by their agile marketing team members. They are also responsible for understanding the target segment and uncovering new or previously untapped sales and service opportunities. The Agile team member embraces continuous change and the autonomy to make their own decisions without necessarily having prescriptive input from management. Team members are eager to gain cross-functional skills across different roles, so must be passionate about learning with a desire to expand both their business and technical knowledge.

        The Senior Data Analyst reports into the Manager, Data & Analytics and has a secondary reporting line into the Pod Lead.

        What will you do?

        • For each campaign, monitor and analyze key performance indicators as well as overall campaign results

        • Proactively identify challenges to campaign success and work with the agile team to find and implement solutions

        • Offer proactive feedback, strategic insights and ideas for campaign improvement

        • Partner with our Analytics team to uncover data driven insights to support the development of marketing strategies for segmented campaigns

        • Partner with our Analytics team and key stakeholders to support the ongoing segmentation/analysis of the member base to drive/inform targeted campaigns and initiatives in support of the key marketing strategies

        • Ensure the accurate and timely completion of all campaign reporting, including distribution and review with key stakeholders

        • Operationalize reporting and related processes to monitor and assess the success of the campaigns

        • Supporting the development of the marketing strategies through a robust understanding of the competitive landscape and industry

        • Providing regular campaign performance reviews to identify problems or opportunities


        What will you need to succeed?

        • Undergraduate in Business, Statistics or Computer Science (or equivalent university degree or college diploma)5+ years’ experience in a Data Analyst or Marketing Performance Analyst role

        • 3+ years\' experience working with SAS or similar tools

        • 2+ years experience with SQL

        • 2 +years’ experience working with Tableau or other visualization tools

        • Experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations for campaigns

        • Experience working with and deriving insight from large data sets

        • Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to break down high-level data into easily communicated information

        • Financial or Insurance services product experience and knowledge preferred

        • Ability to stay organized under conditions of multiple tasks and tight deadlines

        Unique Requirements

        • Must be able to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprints to the RCMP, who then conduct min. 5 year history checks)

        What’s in it for you?

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

        • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

        • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

        • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

        • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

        • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

item.title: Delivery Manager, Data Science
item.description:
• Delivery Manager, Data Science

      North York, Ontario
        Toronto, Ontario
          Waterloo, Ontario
        Apply

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          Role Summary

          This role will be a member of the Data & Analytics team and will be accountable to initiate, plan, mobilize project teams, and govern them through to execution. She/he is accountable to remove barriers and facilitate solutions to address business partner\'s needs.  The successful candidate is expected to have a passion for data analytics and data science solutions and will need to be able to pick up and understand a wide range of analytics tools and solutions.

          What will you do?

          • Owns end-to-end solution delivery.  Accountable for project intake, estimation and resource planning to ensure projects are delivered on time, on budget and with required quality.

          • Work closely with the Architect and the Delivery Director during the concept phase of project to define project delivery approach, methodology.

          • Accountable for the technical leadership from project initiation to implementation. Ensures that a sound and future proof architecture is planned and its implementation meets the technical quality standards.

          • Ensures that appropriate organization, governance, decision making, and delivery structures are in place to drive outcomes articulated in the business case, CBA, business requirements, and program/project charter.

          • Ensures that standards and best practice for project and program management processes are applied to plan, and execute initiatives with high complexity and risk.

          • Contribute ideas for best practice improvements, process improvement, and innovative solutions. Become a member of the Data & Analytics thought leadership team, recommending solutions and products to our business partners aligned to the D&A strategy and roadmap.

          • Engage with executive level stakeholders to educate them on new concepts such as big data, analytics, and data science tools to helping to drive awareness across the organization.

          • Establish project structure and reporting relationships, ensure that everybody understands the project goals and his/her role and responsibilities, encourage good working relationships among all project team members, motivate and resolve conflicts between individual team members.

          What you will need to succeed?

          • University level degree in computer science, data science or related technology degree/diploma. Equivalent experience is also acceptable.

          • 4+ years of experience as delivery manager in data-related projects or equivalent experience.

          • 2+ years of experience executing projects following the data science life cycle.

          • Ideally 2+ years of experience with SQL, Tableau and Python for data analysis, or strong understanding of these tools and how they fit within a data science project.

          • Knowledge of ETL and data modelling.

          • Understanding of predictive analytics/machine learning concepts.

          • Have an end-to-end vision when proposing data solutions from ideation and prototyping up to productionisation.

          • Ability to describe and put into action complex concepts.

          • Ability to lead small, medium and large project teams.

          • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

          • Strong business acumen with strong ability to solve business problems through data driven methodologies.

          • Ability to liaison between different business units and tech teams in order to plan and deliver complex projects with multiple moving pieces.

          • Ability to facilitate business prioritization and decisions.

          • Passion for data and analytics as a career and a willingness to constantly educate herself/himself to stay relevant and keep track of trends in the data space.

          What will be nice to have?

          • Experience working in banking, insurance or healthcare industries

          • Knowledge of big data, analytics and Hadoop concepts

          • Knowledge of cloud concepts and main cloud services offered by open cloud providers (ideally AWS).

          • Experience working in Lean / Agile / Scrum methodologies for enterprise IT delivery.

          What’s in it for you?

          • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

          • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

          • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

          • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

          • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

          • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

          • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

          The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

          Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

          Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

          At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

          We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

          IT - Technology Services

          22/08/2021

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
• Data Scientist

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Role Summary

        Within Sun Life Canada, the Canadian Analytics Centre of Excellence (COE) was launched to support Canadian business units in their journey to leverage data and analytics as a foundational pillar in delivering business value.

        Reporting to the Director, Data Science as a Data Scientist you will focus on supporting Canadian business units in accelerating the growth and application of analytics in driving value.  The data scientist will leverage practical experience in applying varied data science techniques & offering inputs to help with the design, development and implementation of analytics use cases.

        Sun Life views success in this role in demonstration of these key attributes:

        Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. An inquisitive mind. Driven to ask questions to help lead projects to commercial value and not being afraid that the innovation attempts can and will lead to failing. A passion for solving problems.  The most successful data scientists’ solution for what the right data to use, they solve using the most suitable (not most advanced) algorithms for the problem at hand and figure out how to execute and deliver with highest efficiency. Technical skills in both data and computer science.

        What will you do?

        • Apply best in breed data science including descriptive, predictive, machine learning, deep learning and AI techniques from the design to implementation that impacts the business.

        • Focus on Feature Engineering, Model Training and Model Evaluation in addition to data munging / wrangling

        • Identify the right algorithms and statistical techniques for a specific project as well as the best features for a model.  Advise junior members on the same.

        • Assist in make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders

        • An active contributing member to the analytics community to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life

        What will you need to succeed?

        • BSc/M.S. in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science) or equivalent experience

        • Minimum of 1 year experience in developing and implementing data science techniques (predictive, prescriptive, ML etc.)

        • Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources

        • Proficient in using one or more statistical programming languages (i.e., Python) for data science

        • Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka

        • Experience with deep learning methodologies either in practice or in academia

        • Effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication skills

        • Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and priorities

        • Ability to document work and effectively prioritize documentation

        What will be nice to have?

        • Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)

        Unique Requirements

        The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html) ​

        What\'s in it for you?

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

        • 15 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

        • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

        • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

        • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

        • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        Salary Range:

        55,500/55 500 - 91,600/91 600

        Job Category:

        Advanced Analytics

        Posting End Date:

        22/08/2021

            Full time

• Campaign Data Designer

      Toronto, Ontario
        Waterloo, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do.         Job Description:

        Role Summary

        Join a team that is transforming data and analytics at Sun Life Financial (SLF) Canada.  Sun Life’s Client Experience Office (CXO) Client Engagement Engineering area is aggressively enhancing its campaign design and data integration capability with new tools, and most importantly, new talent. 

        As a member of the CXO Engineering team, you will play a pivotal role in working closely with our business partners to enable digital engagement, understand our client needs in new ways, and ultimately enable a leading client experience. 

        As Campaign Designer, you will leverage our vast data, SAS and Big Data capabilities to enable these objectives by designing marketing campaigns and delivering data solutions for our inbound and outbound channels.  In joining CXO Engineering, you will be part of one of the fastest growing areas of our business, representing the future of our business and our industry.

        What will you do?

        • Plan, set up, and execute outbound and inbound digital campaigns and real time decision flows in accordance with the strategy and objectives of campaign stakeholders

        • Gather, document, and help form business requirements, key performance indicators, and other functional and technical requirements

        • Create high quality client experience through use of digital channels, interactive journeys and triggered engagements

        • Support stakeholders and third parties throughout the campaign implementation process

        • Interact frequently with stakeholders including interaction with marketers, analysts, web developers, content and creative designers

        • Manage multiple campaigns simultaneously

        • Gain hands-on experience working with advanced marketing automation platforms, enterprise-level data structures and complex MarTech integrations

        • Perform extensive data profiling and develop deep understanding of the highly complex data landscape.

        • Deepen the organizations understanding of client and member level data and provide expert guidance on how best to leverage data to provide actionable business insight

        • Collaborates in an agile team to understand business objectives and develop campaign solutions that deliver best in class, engaging and highly relevant experiences

        • Liaise with stakeholders across other teams to resolve discrepancies

        • Support campaign target list generation, analyses, measurement and reporting

        What will you need to succeed?

        • Bachelor Degree in a field with a strong technical core such as Computer Science, Software engineering, Business Analytics, Engineering Science, Statistics, Math, Business Commerce or equivalent working experience

        • Over 5 years experience in campaign design, data management and a solid understanding of the data needs of marketing, campaigns and business.  

        • Over 3 years experience in SQL programming and database development

        • Demonstrated experience in database querying and reporting and developing campaign lists for direct marketing campaigns

        • The candidates must have relevant experience in the following areas:

          • Knowledge of Inbound and Outbound campaigns

          • Knowledge on the data needs for analytics and campaigns

          • Communication and liaison experience between business, analytics and IT

        Competencies: 

        • Solid communication skills – have the ability to explain complexity of  data to a business audience and explain the complexity of business to the IT audience

        • Adaptable - maintains effectiveness while managing competing demands, able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events

        • Organized, takes ownership to meet deadlines and commitments

        What will be nice to have?

        • Related work experience in Campaign execution and operations, marketing automation, digital communications, database marketing and data analysis, decision engines (e.g. SAS RTDM)

        • General programming language knowledge and basic application design

        • Marketing Automation tool experience

        • Experience in marketing campaign execution, including segmentation and/or list development.

        • Intermediate SAS skills is good to have

        • Marketing Automation platform such as Adobe Campaign, Siebel Marketing or Salesforce Pardot

        ​What’s in it for you?

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

        • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

        • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

        • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

        • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

        • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        Salary Range:

        67,400/67 400 - 110,100/110 100

        Marketing

item.title: Strategy Analyst
item.description:
• Strategy Analyst

      Toronto, Ontario
        Waterloo, Ontario
          North York, Ontario
        Apply

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          Sun Life is a leading financial services organization whose focus is to help Clients achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives. With team members based around the world, the Enterprise IT division of Sun Life is working hard to align and accelerate the digital ambitions of the company. Be a part of a high-performing, diverse and talented work force as we enable Sun Life’s exciting digital transformation.

          The Role:

          This role will provide planning support, contributions to strategic thought leadership, and internal consulting support to senior executives within Digital Business & Technology Solutions (DBTS) and to our various business partners throughout the organization. Particular focus for this role will be in the area of research and competitive intelligence gathering and development of working presentations for review by participants in our digital transformation.

          What will you do?

          The Strategy Analyst’s main accountabilities include, but are not limited to:

          • Strategy and innovation – Support the CIO, our Technology executives, delivery teams and our business partners to help define and advance our strategic ambitions.
          • Digital transformation – Collaborate on key initiatives within Sun Life’s digital transformation programs—our drive to embrace agile principles at scale to deliver leading client experiences on our digital platforms—including the target operating model, organizational design, digital metrics and objectives.
          • Technology metrics – Assist with the development and management of operational metrics, objectives and key results (OKRs), and a DBTS balanced scorecard that provides insights on the progress towards operational and transformational technology ambitions.
          • Engagement and external outreach – Remain abreast of external trends in the digital space by participating in the start-up, FinTech and InsurTech communities, connect with vendor partners, attend external conferences. Share learnings and insights with the team to stay connected with industry trends.
          • Digital evangelism – Increase the presence of IT across the organization in executive-level communications, reporting and business development.

          What you need to succeed:

          • Two or more years of experience relevant to the accountabilities listed above.
          • A post-secondary or equivalent degree with a focus (i.e. major) on one of the following:
            • Engineering or Technology, with supporting education or experience in business management.
            • Business Management, with supporting education or experience in digital technology.
            • Humanities or Communications, with supporting education or experience in both business management and digital technology.
          • Excellent and demonstrable MS PowerPoint skills, including an understanding of presentation process (storyboarding and visual design best practices).
          • Excellent and demonstrable MS Excel skills in the context of financial management, including the corresponding ability to visualize, interpret and report results.
          • Excellent communication skills, written and oral. Writing skills include an ability to translate technical content into layman’s terms consumable by senior executive readers.
          • Previous working experience, or a demonstrable interest, in digital innovation.
          • Superior interpersonal skills and the ability to navigate and build relationships in a large organization.

          An asset:

          • Experience with executive communications, e.g., workshops, reporting to C-suite or external audience.
          • Management or technology consulting experience.
          • Experience in the FinTech, InsurTech or traditional financial services.
          • Specialized experience in any of the following enterprise technologies: application programming interface (API), data & analytics (“big data”), cloud infrastructure, DevOps, cyber security, web or mobile development.
          • Experience with agile delivery methodologies.
          • digital technology an asset – Data & Analytics, Cybersecurity, Cloud, Digital.
          • Experience in financial services and/or finance background.
          • Experience in marketing, UX/UI design, graphic design.

          What’s in it for you:

          • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
          • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
          • An environment of continuous learning and improvement
          • Flexible hours and periodic work from home options

          L1 - SJ

          The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

• Marketing Consultant, Social Media

      Waterloo, Ontario
        Toronto, Ontario

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          ** 1 year contract opportunity **

          This role will be reporting to the Manager, Social Media Strategy within the Canadian Marketing team in the Client Experience Office (CXO). Staying up to date with social media trends isn’t just part of the job description, it’s a way of life for you. You spend your time convincing others what social media tools should be used to reach target audiences, and although your effective communication and collaboration skills help you influence stakeholders, your secret weapon is your ability to convert data into actionable insights. You find joy in interpreting data from social media platforms to influence the creative used, and use your creative thinking and digital expertise to craft compelling, shareable content. You understand the speed of the platforms and know what it takes to optimize a campaign in real time for conversions and to drive profitable ROI.

          What will you do?

          • Manage paid activities across all social media channels for the Sun Life brand (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, etc).

          • Manage Sun Life Canada\'s organic content calendar and work with internal contributors

          • Use Excel and Adobe Analytics daily to gather data for creating visually appealing and easy to understand dashboards

          • Provide interpretation, guidance and recommendations to optimize the end-to-end campaign (including segments, creative, content, networks, channels, tactics, etc) on an ongoing basis

          • Deliver detailed and actionable insights and strategic recommendations on social media tactics

          What do you need to succeed?

          • Ability to speak and write in English (French is an asset)

          • University or college degree in Business, Communications, digital marketing, or related fields 

          • 3 years experience in paid social media marketing (Facebook Ads Manager)

          • 3 years experience in managing a large brand for reputational risks

          • 1-3 years experiedashboard creation and reporting

          • Experience with managing social communities: developing, leading and executing social media strategies and analyzing and reporting results

          • Experience managing campaign budgets

          • Ability to demonstrate hands on experience for the required key platforms: Facebook business manager, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, Pinterest, Hootsuite, Brandwatch, and Adobe Analytics

          • Solid project management skills 

          • Stay on top of industry trends and all applicable technologies, including developments in – Ad Display, Social media, and digital consumer behavior

          • Previous Digital Marketing agency experience is an asset

item.title: Manager, Internal Audit, Investments
item.description:
• Manager, Internal Audit, Investments

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Wellesley
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Manager, Internal Audit - Investments

        About the business: 

        Internal Audit (IA) contributes to the company through the execution of high quality audit services, which help our clients proactively manage risks in their business. The Manager reports to the Associate Director, Internal Audit - Investments in the SLC Management (SLC) team.

        Sun Life Financial (SLF) has the ambition to be one of the best insurance and asset management companies in the world. The Manager will participate in audits of the processes that support our key goals in our SLC business group. Through these audits, the Manager will have the opportunity of furthering their experience and skills in understanding the business, identifying risks, and assessing control effectiveness through interaction with middle and senior management in the organization. The incumbent should be prepared to use the opportunities offered by these projects to learn and grow their own capabilities in business, risk and control understanding, while contributing to delivering high quality Internal Audit work.

        About the role:

        The role will lead audits and projects of the SLC Management (Investments) business. The role includes significant client interaction. The incumbent will play a key role in supporting Internal Audit in providing assurance over controls within core processes.

        Responsibilities: 

        • Work with the Associate Director and the AVP – Internal Audit on planning, executing and reporting risk-based integrated audit work.

        • Review prior audits and gather current information by meeting with business leaders to identify key current and emerging risks to the process under audit.

        • Document business objectives, risks, key controls, and test strategy to ensure that our audit objectives and approach service broader business needs.

        • Assess key control design and execute testing of key controls, including IT controls.

        • Oversee resources assigned to assist in completion of the engagement and review their working papers.

        • Communicate to management throughout the engagement on our audit process and status.  Discuss potential control gaps and recommendations with management timely.

        • Prepare the audit report and rationale for the audit opinion.

        • Identify opportunities to automate testing using data analytics.  

        • Manage multiple audit projects simultaneously within assigned time and budget.

        • Appropriately escalate project delays and issues to the Associate Director.

        • Stay current on best practices in risk management and control assessment and share information internally related to industry thought leadership and best practices.

        Qualifications:

        • University degree in accounting, finance or business.

        • 5-8 years of audit experience in the financial services industry or equivalent.

        • Experience in assessing and testing IT controls.

        • Exposure to investment operations and products or asset management business.

        • Professional audit designation (e.g. CPA, CFA, CIA, CISA).

        • CFA designation is a strong asset.

        • Ability to understand complex business processes and identify key risks and controls.

        • Knowledge and understanding of control frameworks (e.g. COSO, COBIT, etc).

        • Knowledge of audit techniques, including planning, scoping, testing of internal controls, reporting, and data analytics.

        • Project management experience will be also valued and considered.

        Preferred Skills:

        • Excellent written and oral communication skills with ability to influence.

        • Ability to understand business and IT processes and a strong business knowledge.

        • Pro-active, high-energy, dedicated, flexible, and good practical judgement.

        • Team player, ability to multi-task, detail-oriented, strong commitment to quality, analytical, strong problem solving and consultative skills.

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        Salary Range:

        67,400/67 400 - 110,100/110 100

        Job Category:

        Internal Audit

        Posting End Date:

        30/08/2021

We\'re there for our Clients in the moments that matter most. We create opportunities to make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities  around the world.

item.title: B2B Support Analyst
item.description:
• B2B Support Analyst

      North York, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Toronto One York
          Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
        Apply

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          The Data and Analytics Technology team requires a B2B Support Analyst who can support production file transfer applications for both internal and external clients.  The candidate must work well within a dynamic environment and have a strong ability to understand complex applications and handle multiple requests and priorities.  We value collaborative team players who will use their problem solving and analytical skills to maintain and improve application stability and performance to satisfy client and business objectives

          • Follow established procedures to service and support the file transfer environment
          • Accept user requests, triage and analyze them, then complete or assign as appropriate
          • Handle changes, incidents and problems per ITIL model
          • Consult with internal and external clients to determine requirements for successful project deliverables 
          • Act as an interface and provide advice and backup to other analysts and network support personnel 
          • Work with external vendors and service providers as required

          • 2 years of experience in supporting production systems
          • Ability to manage multiple projects/tasks, organize work and set priorities
          • Strong analytical skills with an eye for detail and accuracy
          • Customer and results focused, with an ability to work with stakeholders to understand and act based on their needs and achieve a valued result
          • Comfortable with ambiguity and able to operate in a matrix environment with complex tasks
          • Comfortable learning new applications and processes quickly with minimal direction

item.title: Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant - Actuarial Lead
item.description:
• Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant - Actuarial Lead

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        We are looking for a Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant to join Sun Life’s Campus Talent Acquisition team. You will be part of a high performing team, where collaboration, diverse perspective, business partnership and most importantly your personal development is top priority. You will be exposed and work with agile methodologies, focusing on client and candidate needs and experience.

        You will play the lead role in proactively sourcing and engaging top actuarial talent, managing actuarial talent communities, identifying and redeploying internal talent and advising business leaders on recruitment strategies. You will be part of an ambitious, driven, and data-focused Talent Acquisition team. Above all, you will be responsible for attracting our most important asset – our people!

        What will you do?

        You will have the opportunity to own and execute the talent acquisition strategy, process and delivery for our Actuarial team at Sun Life. You will develop talent pipelines, and engage and recruit exceptional talent in our Actuarial Development program (Campus) and senior Actuarial roles across the business.

        This is a role for the experienced recruiter who:

        • Acts as a strategic advisor to help define and develop business segment strategies and influence Hiring Managers to focus on future skills needs
        • Provides market intelligence and insight to develop sourcing and recruitment strategies to attract and retain top talent.
        • Leverages data and analytics to build strategies and acts proactively to meet business hiring needs
        • Creates measure and reports on ROI, KPI’s to measure success of the recruitment process and campus initiatives.
        • Builds and nurtures relationships with our key school partners
        • Develops and executes a full social media strategy
        • Supports Diversity and Inclusion and understands the positive impact it has on company culture and the businesses bottom line

        What do you need to succeed?

        • Advanced sourcing capabilities leveraging social networks, research tools, as well as more creative techniques to identify potential talent
        • Highly skilled in relationship building; possesses skills to quickly establish trust, credibility and effectively manage others through influence
        • Creative thinking and ability to find solutions based on clients’ needs.
        • Flexible and resilient; able to adapt to multiple demands, shifting priorities and changing business conditions
        • Ability to navigate ambiguity and solve complex problems while collaborating with business partners to achieve a common goal
        • Data-driven in everything you do; you take pride in data quality and data integrity

        What’s in it for you?

        • A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture
        • An environment of continuous learning and improvement
        • Work-life balance by scheduling your day around your priorities and having more time to spend on the important things
        • Competitive salary and bonus structure!
        • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program
        • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family
        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
        • The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

• Associate Software Engineer

      Waterloo, Ontario
    Apply

    • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self.
